We typically ask colleagues to spend a minimum of 8 days per month working in-person to support collaboration and connection. Specific arrangements will be confirmed by your recruiter to ensure they meet the needs of the role and team.Why work with us?The Bank of Ireland company culture prioritises work-life balance with an opportunity for flexible working, along with 23 days annual leave and excellent pension contributions. Family can mean different things to different people; we offer 6 months paid maternity leave, an innovative fertility and surrogacy policy and working parent supports.Your wellbeing is important to us; we have an employee assistance program, WebDoctor and financial wellbeing coaches available. We also encourage and support staff to pursue educational and professional qualifications to grow and enhance your career!Key CompetenciesAccountable - SelfAmplify Capability - SelfCustomer Focused - SelfAgile - SelfOne Group, one team - SelfBank of Ireland Group is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace which values and benefits from the diversity of our workforce.Where Agency assistance is required Bank of Ireland Recruitment Team will engage directly with suppliers. Unsolicited CVs / profiles supplied to Bank of Ireland by Recruitment Agencies will not be accepted for this role.

At Financefair, we're not just another Fintech company. We're a dedicated team of finance professionals who leverage innovative technologies and data-driven insights to offer fast, flexible, and tailored financial solutions to help SMEs grow.Over the last 9 years Financefair has provided over €2.0 billion of funding to a wide range of customers across all sectors. We are in a period of rapid growth, launching new technology, expanding our team, and scaling our customer base. Our mission is to empower businesses by unlocking their potential through access to growth funding.The RoleThe Senior Credit Analyst will support Financefair’s SME funding and receivables finance activities through high-quality credit analysis, underwriting, and portfolio monitoring. The role is designed for a developing credit professional who can independently assess risk, contribute to credit decisioning, and support the evolution of Financefair’s credit framework while operating within established policies and governance.Key ResponsibilitiesConduct and review underwriting of SME financing applications and ongoing portfolio monitoring by analysing financial statements, cash flow, management accounts, and transactional dataActively monitor the credit portfolio, identifying emerging risks, early warning indicators, and deterioration trends, and proactively escalating material risk issues with proposed mitigants to senior stakeholdersLiaise with internal and external advisors (e.g. legal, insolvency practitioners) on transaction-specific matters when requiredAssist in the maintenance and continuous improvement of credit procedures and documentationUtilise credit systems, data tools, and fintech platforms to enhance underwriting efficiency and accuracyProvide guidance to graduate analysts and interns, including reviewing work, sharing best practices, and supporting their development in credit analysis and risk judgementThe Ideal CandidateMinimum 2 years' experience in credit analysis, risk, lending, banking, or audit within financial servicesDegree in finance, business, economics, accounting, or a related discipline/work experienceCurious, adaptable and tech-savvy, with an interest in fintech and data-driven credit assessment. Excel skills preferable.Strong communications skills with sound judgement and commercial awareness, balancing risk management with business growthProactive, collaborative, and comfortable taking ownership of outcomesWorking At FinancefairCompetitive salary with performance related bonus opportunityA contributory pension scheme with life assurance and other insurancesA contribution to a healthcare plan of your choice or gym membershipA company who invests in the learning and development of its peopleA great team with a good sense of fun

Optum is a global organisation that delivers care, aided by technology, to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.As a Fortune 5 business, we're one of the world's leading healthcare companies. There are no limits here on the resources you'll have or the challenges you'll encounter.We have been supporting global healthcare systems from Ireland and the UK for more than 20 years, building a dynamic and diverse team of more than 2,100 talented individuals. With a continued record of growth and stability, we're on the constant lookout for fresh talent to join our expanding teams.As a member of a newly established team, you will provide financial analytics and modelling to support Optum Rx Finance and Accounting operations. This team is responsible for initiatives that impact OptumRx's leading clients and the broader business, offering financial modelling and analysis related to major accounts, identifying key drivers of client financial outcomes and profitability, and collaborating with internal stakeholders to implement effective solutions. Principal duties include performing financial forecasting and modelling, leveraging data analytics to deliver insights into financial performance, trend drivers and supporting strategic projects via analytical expertise.You will be technically accomplished with a quantitative mindset, a strong aptitude for complex problem-solving, and a keen eye for process improvement. Your curiosity will drive you to seek innovative ways to analyze data and challenge existing practices.Careers with Optum offer flexible work arrangements and individuals who live and work in the Republic of Ireland will have the opportunity to split their monthly work hours between our Dublin or Letterkenny and telecommuting from a home-based office in a hybrid work model. Primary ResponsibilitiesLeverage analytics and modelling insights to understand the factors driving client financial performanceCollaborate with stakeholders and experts to ensure analyses address business needs, anticipating and solving issues proactivelySupport integration efforts for existing models and develop new models to support client scenarios analysisEfficiently deliver on ad-hoc analysis requests from a wide range of stakeholdersDevelop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present findings clearly and effectivelyYou will be rewarded and recognised for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role, as well as providing development for other roles you may be interested inRequired QualificationsBachelor's degree (or higher) in relevant field (analytics, mathematics, economics, business, statistics, engineering, or finance) OR equivalent experienceKnowledge of SQL, Databricks and/or Python, with the ability to perform effective and efficient querying involving multiple tables and subqueriesProven experience in analyzing and interpreting large volumes of data from disparate sources, with the ability to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the analysesPreferred QualificationsExperience in finance and financial modelling / forecastingHealthcare, PBM or Pharma experienceSoft SkillsEffective communication skills, able to collaborate with stakeholders from multiple levels and disciplinesProblem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilitiesDemonstrates accuracy and attention to detailPlease note you must currently be eligible to work and remain indefinitely without any restrictions in the country to which you are making an application. Proof will be required to support your application.All telecommuters will be required to adhere to the UnitedHealth Group's Telecommuter Policy.At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone-of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income-deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalised groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: Optum is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive c

📝 Company MissionOur mission is to give the world access to the best products by empowering great businesses to reach their growth potential.💼 About WayflyerToday's SMB's need a capital provider that keeps pace with their growth ambitions. Traditional financing options are slow, cumbersome and often out of reach. That's why we built Wayflyer.Our unique technology allows us to assess businesses in minutes, generate financing offers that reflect their growth potential and send funds in as little as 24 hours.Since launching in April 2020, we've deployed over $5bn to thousands of brands worldwide, backed by Tier 1 banks like J.P. Morgan. We've become a trusted financing partner for some amazing brands, like True Classic, Little Words Project and Kekoa Foods.Teams at Wayflyer are truly cross-functional. You'll be collaborating with ambitious colleagues from around the world - all striving to deliver on a huge opportunity. Check out this video to hear directly from them.💛 Culture & Values at WayflyerAt Wayflyer, we value being sound people, excellent operators, and ambitious overachievers, working together with integrity, creativity, and bold optimism to deliver exceptional results. To learn more, please visit our website.🚀 Your Role at a Glance: The key ways you'll bring value to the teamOwn the design, maintenance, and governance of Wayflyer’s credit risk policies and frameworks across all customer segments, ensuring they enable growth while maintaining strong credit discipline.Translate Wayflyer’s risk appetite into actionable and measurable frameworks, covering underwriting, portfolio management, exposure limits, and approval authorities.Lead the periodic review of credit policies, exposure caps, and delegated authorities, ensuring alignment with business goals, funding partner requirements, and market conditions.Act as the key liaison between Risk, Finance, Legal, and Revenue teams to ensure that all policies are practical, compliant, and support scalable credit growth.Build governance structures (committees, review cadence, escalation pathways) to embed credit risk management into daily operations.Provide analytical and strategic input to senior leadership on credit performance trends and policy implications.Support new product development and market entry initiatives by designing frameworks that align new offerings with Wayflyer’s risk appetite.Lead continuous improvement of credit policies and frameworks by leveraging portfolio data, loss experience, and emerging industry best practices.🔨 What Makes You a Great Fit6 to 8+ years of experience in credit risk management, policy design, or risk governance, ideally in fintech, alternative lending, or commercial banking.Proven experience developing and maintaining credit policies or frameworks for SME, Ecommerce, or trade finance portfolios. Strong understanding of credit underwriting principles, portfolio management, and regulatory/risk frameworks.Excellent analytical and communication skills, able to translate risk concepts into actionable frameworks and policies.Skilled at cross-functional collaboration, working closely with Product, Finance, Legal, and Data teams.Experience in reviewing credit performance data and using insights to adjust policy parameters.High attention to detail with the ability to balance structure and agility in a fast-paced environment.How You’ll Stand OutExperience working with structured finance or warehouse funding arrangements.Familiarity with working capital products such as MCAs, STLs and LOCs.Exposure to the e-commerce sector and the funding needs of the e-commerce clients.Exposure to data-driven credit scoring and automated decisioning.Advanced degree or certification in finance, economics, or risk (CFA, FRM, or similar).🤝 What to Expect After You ApplyYou can expect to hear from a member of our Talent Acquisition team soon. If we believe you're a good fit, the first step will be a conversation with a recruiter who will guide you through the next stages of the process. The full interview process, which includes meeting the Hiring Manager and completing a case study or interview loop, typically takes approximately two to four weeks.🏖️The Perks of Being at Wayflyer🌴 Time Off That MattersRecharge with 25 days of paid annual leave, plus public holidays.🧘 Your WellbeingAccess support and resources to support your wellbeing, including our Wellbeing @ Wayflyer ERG.🫀 Comprehensive Health & ProtectionStay covered with private healthcare, life insurance, and critical illness cover.👵 Secure Your Future with Our Pension PlanOur pension plan helps you build a strong foundation for tomorrow, starting today.🍼 Family-First PoliciesWe offer generous parental and adoptive leave, including 6 months of paid leave for Primary Caregivers and 3 months of paid leave for Secondary Caregivers.💰 Share in Our SuccessWith our equity scheme, you're not just an employee; you're a stakeholder in our journey.🌴 Work From Abroad!Enjoy the freedom to work remotel

Job Title – Finance Lead – Treasury Financial ReportingLocation – London/DublinHybrid - 2 days per week (Dublin only)PermanentFlutter consists of two commercial divisions (FanDuel and International) and our central Flutter Functions; COO, Finance & Legal. Here in Flutter Functions we work with colleagues across all our divisions and regions to deliver something we call the Flutter Edge. It’s our competitive advantage, our ‘secret sauce’ which plays a key part in our ongoing success and powers our brands and divisions, through Product, Tech, Expertise and Scale.In Flutter Finance we pride ourselves in providing global expertise to ensure Flutter is financially healthy. Utilising our Flutter Edge to turbo-charge our capabilities.About the role:Reporting to the Director of External Reporting and Technical Accounting, this role is a key part of the Group Reporting team. The Finance Lead - Treasury Financial Reporting oversees financial instruments under US GAAP and IFRS, including hedge accounting.This role manages all treasury financial instrument reporting and controls, including derivatives, hedge accounting, funding, and external financial reporting. Lead routine activities, ensure accuracy, compliance, and efficient control framework.The ideal candidate will show excellent decision-making skills and effectively assist the Director of External Reporting & Technical Accounting in identifying and addressing issues early.What you’ll do Support the Group Treasurer, Group Director Tax, and Director of External Reporting & Technical Accounting by advising on treasury accounting, financial reporting, and controlling activities, assisting with funding and restructuring efforts, and formulating debt servicing strategies and policies, including transfer pricing considerations.Take charge of all accounting matters associated with the Group's financing activities, overseeing all technical accounting issues, including hedge accounting and debt issuance (Term Loan A, Term Loan B, and Senior Notes issued under rule 144A) in close partnership with the Head of External Reporting.Take a vital part in building in-house financial tools for a robust finance function and collaborative relationships with other departments.Lead change activities for treasury accounting, advancing risk identification and developing mitigation plans promptly for desired outcomesSupervise the preparation and assessment of all financial reports related to treasury, encompassing activities like month-end closures, quarterly and yearly reporting, and regulatory document submissions. This involves reporting on derivatives, hedge accounting, internal and external debt, and financing cash flows.Support the Deputy Group Treasurer with budgeting of interest expense and incomeSupport the Tax advisory team in understanding the accounting for financing transactions to facilitate transfer pricing of internal loansOffer perceptive analysis of budget versus actual treasury activities to senior managementCollaborate with an external service provider to assist with the record-keeping and booking of Dutch special purpose financing entities. Evaluate and question the outcomes to guarantee accuracy and thoroughness.Supervise the hedge accounting process, guaranteeing adherence to US GAAP and reporting standards. This encompasses hedge categorization, paperwork, effectiveness evaluation, and disclosures.Partner with external contractor(s) to secure accurate and timely valuations and reporting. Evaluate and scrutinize deliverables, ensuring they are complete and precise.Develop and uphold a strong control structure for treasury financial reporting, ensuring SOX compliance and other regulations, addressing control gaps, and managing treasury systems and their control environments.Streamline Treasury Finance operations through process improvement, role clarity, and better inter-team communication.Lead reporting on projects impacting treasury activities & SOX controls, incl. tax restructurings, new treasury instruments, group transactions, & tech/process changes.Develop and maintain treasury reporting policies and procedures, ensuring alignment with guidelines and regulatory requirements.Develop and nurture connections with essential collaborators in Group Finance and Global Finance.Support the Director of External Reporting & Technical Accounting as needed, with functional or other senior Flutter collaborators on matters related to strategicLead a small treasury financial reporting team, offering support and training, while evaluating team growth needs based on business changes.How you’ll do it Qualified Accountant with 7 – 10+ years of progressive experience, preferably gained in a multi-national / plc environment or a Big-4 accounting firmIFRS and US GAAP experienceConfident and assertive, capable of working effectively with high-level collaboratorsDemonstrated history crafting robust internal control structures (SOX or similar in highly regulated field) and enhancing op

job_title: Senior Finance Analyst, Data Centre Finance - EMEA
job_description: DescriptionDo you want to directly influence the future of some of the most successful products in cloud computing? Come join Amazon Web Services Finance! Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of enterprise, government and start-up business and organizations in over 190 countries around the world. Launched in 2006, Amazon Web Services officially began offering developer customers access to web services – now widely known as cloud computing – based on Amazon’s own back-end technology platform.On the AWS Finance team you will be surrounded by people that are exceptionally talented, bright, and driven, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success. To support this quickly growing business, you must be highly analytical and possess a strong passion for analytics and accountability, setting high standards, and razor-sharp accuracy. We take working hard, having fun, and making history seriously and you should too!We provide end-to-end financial support driving AWS to be the low cost provider in Cloud computing and leader in customer experience. This includes supporting business owners in building, operating and innovating our Cloud datacenters. We support operations, business development, and engineering. You should be passionate about producing financial analysis enabling management to make breakthrough decisions, drive cash flow, and ultimately delight our customers.We are growing rapidly in existing regions as well as expanding into new regions.Key job responsibilitiesAs a member of this team, you will work with regional AWS leadership to: Serve as a key business partner working directly with regional AWS management and other internal stakeholders to provide financial recommendations Report weekly and monthly financial and operating metrics Manage the financial planning process. Model, analyze and forecast metrics that drive budgeting, forecasting and business decisions Be an integral member in the monthly financial close process and perform ad-hoc projects and analysis as needed Analyze business results for key takeaways to achieve business objectives Monitor compliance with controls and systems, and developing new processes to support the fast-growing, global AWS business Preparing detailed financial models for business segments, drive business initiatives, and identify, implement, and deliver key operational efficienciesBasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in accounting, information systems, finance, or equivalent Experience in tax, finance or a related analytical field Experience in accounts receivable or account payable Experience applying key financial performance indicators (KPIs) to analyses Experience in financial modeling, P&L management or analysis Experience in creating process improvements with automation and analysis Experience in identifying, leading, and executing opportunities to improve, automate, standardize or simplify finance or business tools and processes Experience with advanced use of SQL for data mining and business intelligencePreferred Qualifications MBA, or CPA Experience participating in continuous improvement projects in your team to scale and improve controllership with measurable results Experience working with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (examples: SQL, MS Access, Essbase, Cognos) and other financial systems (examples: Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards) Experience with VBA, Python, SQL, or other database languageAmazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.Company - Amazon Data Services Ireland LimitedJob ID: A3129526

Executive SummaryWe are seeking a strategic Co-Founder and Investor to unite BooleanForce (IT Services) and World Wise Scholars (Study Abroad Consultancy) under a single holding company.Both brands are established, with live websites and existing client bases. We have the operational foundation; we now need capital and high-level strategic leadership to scale.2. The OpportunityBy merging these two entities, we create a unique ecosystem:· BooleanForce builds the technology.· World Wise Scholars recruits the global talent.· Synergy: We can retain talent (WWS finds students, BooleanForce trains/employs them) and offer "end-to-end" global career solutions.3. What We Bring (Current Assets)· Two fully developed, live, and operational brands.· Existing client relationships and revenue streams.· Technical infrastructure and educational consultancy expertise.· A clear path to cross-promotion and market penetration.4. The Ask (Investment & Role)We are offering a Co-Founder/Equity Partner position in the new parent company.· Investment Required: $ (7 lakh) (to be used for marketing, hiring key staff, and product development).· Equity Offered: 30% stake in the consolidated holding company.· Role: Strategic oversight, financial planning, and business development (Active Partner).5. Use of FundsThe investment will be deployed to:1. Marketing & Sales: Aggressive digital campaigns for both brands.2. Product Development: Creating the "Study Abroad + Tech Internship" joint package.3. Operations: Hiring a dedicated sales manager and support staff.4. Working Capital: To sustain and accelerate growth.6. Vision & Exit Strategy· Vision: To become the leading gateway for international students to access global tech careers.· Exit: Build the entity for acquisition by a larger EdTech group or a private equity roll-up within 1–3 years.7. Next Steps1. online meeting for full plan.2. Sign NDA.3. Review detailed financials and traffic data.4. Meet to finalize terms and draft the Partnership Agreement.

We are partnering with a well-established Pan-European private debt platform to hire an Investment Analyst for its Dublin based investment team.This is a strong opportunity to join an active credit investor focused on mid-cap corporate transactions across Ireland, the DACH region, and broader continental Europe. The strategy spans sponsored and non-sponsored deals across the capital structure, including Senior Secured, Unitranche, Mezzanine, and Minority Equity.The successful candidate will support deal professionals across the full investment lifecycle from origination and due diligence through execution and ongoing portfolio monitoring.The Role:Investment ProcessReviewing information memoranda and third-party due diligence reportsPreparing investment committee materialsBuilding and maintaining detailed financial models (including scenario and sensitivity analysis)Conducting comparable transaction and precedent financing analysisPerforming market and desktop researchExecutionSupporting term sheet discussions and reviewing legal documentationAssisting with transaction closing and fundingOngoing portfolio monitoring and performance trackingAdditional ResponsibilitiesPreparing investor marketing materialsMaintaining pipeline trackers and internal systemsAssisting with NDAs, release letters, and related documentationKey Requirements:2–5 years’ experience in leveraged finance, corporate credit, corporate finance, or investment bankingProactive, with a willingness to take on responsibilities beyond core day-to-day tasksHigh level of attention to detailAdvanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPointExcellent academic record and strong interpersonal skillsAdditional languages such as German, Italian, or Spanish are advantageous

Job Title: Investment AnalystSector: Global Investment FirmLocation: Dublin - HybridSalary: Base negotiable plus exceptional bonus opportunity and benefitsOur ClientOur client are a Global Investment Firm. They have a track-record of delivering exceptional results and have an excellent reputation globally.Why should you apply?This is an excellent opportunity for a driven and ambitious individual who is seeking to advance their career in an exciting industry. We are currently partnering with a well-established, mid-market private equity fund based in Dublin.This is an excellent opportunity to join an active fund with a strong track record of deploying capital in Ireland. The team invests in scalable, growth-oriented businesses and takes a hands-on approach to value creation.You will work directly with senior investment professionals across:Deal origination and evaluationFinancial modelling and valuation (LBO, DCF, comps)Transaction execution and due diligenceInvestment committee materialsPortfolio company monitoring and strategic initiativesThe role offers meaningful responsibility, exposure to high-quality transactions, and clear progression potential.We are keen to speak with candidates who have:1–4 years’ experience in private markets, investment banking, transaction services (Big 4), corporate finance, or strategy consultingStrong financial modelling and analytical skillsExcellent academic credentialsHigh levels of commercial awareness and attention to detailThe ability to operate in a lean, high-performance environmentACA or CFA is highly desirable. This role offers the opportunity to join a high-performing team, gain extensive buy-side credit analysis experience, and be involved in executing and managing big ticket real estate transactions.Responsibilities:Conduct detailed analysis to support new investment recommendations.Proactively manage credit risk across existing investments.Prepare and present concise credit memos and insights to the Executive Team and Investment Committee.Oversee transaction execution, including due diligence, negotiations, documentation, and Investment Committee processes.Key Requirements:A minimum of 2 years’ experience in investment analysis, specialized credit, or corporate finance.A strong academic background in quantitative fields such as finance, engineering, mathematics, or economics.Financial modelling skills and proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.Commercial with the ability to cultivate long-term relationships.Excellent communication skills and strong attention to detail.Professional qualifications (CFA, ACA, ACCA, or CAIA) are desirable.A team player with a proactive mindset, geared toward learning and collaboration.Please note that, due to the high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Investment Analyst - Private Debt (Dublin)A well-established international investment firm is seeking to appoint an Investment Analyst to join its European Private Debt team in Dublin. This is an excellent opportunity for someone early in their investment career who wants genuine exposure to live deals and long-term progression within investments.The team focuses on lending to mid-sized businesses across Ireland, the DACH region and wider Europe. For a confidential discussion around opportunities in the market, please contact me directly -

A leading Property developer is seeking an Investment Manager to support the growth of its strategic pipeline across Ireland.The role will focus on identifying, evaluating and securing investing opportunities, managing the process from initial sourcing through acquisition and early-stage development, working closely with internal investment, planning, technical and legal teams.Key Responsibilities: Source and assess new land opportunities, including off-market and strategic sites Undertake feasibility analysis, site appraisals and market research Lead negotiations on land acquisitions, options and contracts Coordinate planning, technical, environmental and legal due diligence Prepare acquisition papers and investment recommendations Manage stakeholder engagement with landowners, agents and local authorities Support the transition from acquisition into the development phaseCandidate Profile 5+ years’ experience in land acquisition, development or real estate investment Strong understanding of Irish planning, zoning and development processes Proven negotiation and stakeholder management capability Commercially minded, with experience assessing risk and preparing investment cases Degree in property, planning, real estate or a related discipline preferred Chartered Surveyor (RICS etc.) beneficialTo discuss this opportunity in confidence, contact Diarmuid Clancy via dclancy@elevatepartners.ie or apply directly via the link provided.

Position: Feasibility and Investment Analyst - Hotel DevelopmentLocation: Dublin, IrelandDetail: Hybrid working (Office and Home)At Staycity Group, we bring together two leading aparthotel brands - Staycity Aparthotels and Wilde Aparthotels - united by a shared commitment to modern, flexible hospitality. Across our properties and support teams, our goal is simple: to deliver exceptional experiences for our guests and create an environment where our people can do their best work.Whether you're joining our operations or head office teams, you'll be part of a fast-growing European hospitality group built on our values of curiosity, drive, collaboration, kindness, and respect. We're a diverse and inclusive team that encourages you to bring your unique self to work - because we believe great hospitality starts with people who feel valued, supported, and inspired to grow.RoleWe are seeking a detail-oriented and highly analytical to join our feasibility team. This role is central to underwriting lease transactions and assessing the financial viability of new aparthotel projects. The successful candidate will focus on market research, feasibility analysis, and performance monitoring to support Staycity's continued expansion.This is an excellent opportunity for someone with a strong background in data analysis, financial modelling or investment analysis-whether gained in hospitality, real estate, consulting, or other sectors-who is eager to apply their skills in the fast-growing aparthotel sector.BenefitsPaid family leave (>1 year of service)Flexible working patternsGenerous holiday allowanceMatched pension contributionsHealth and Dental InsuranceBonus scheme that rewards high performers;- based on our core values and tied to individual property goalsDiscounted rates for overnight stays for you, your family and friendsRefer and earn scheme if you successfully refer a friend to work with usCycle to work scheme- to support a healthy lifestyle and our planetEducation Support to help you foster new skillsVolunteer days: 2 paid volunteer days per yearSupport for you and your family when you need it with our Employee Assistance Program (EAP)We would love you to have...Bachelor's degree in Finance, Real Estate, Economics, Business, or a related field. A Master's degree or professional certification is a plus.Minimum 3 years' experience in data analysis, financial modelling, investment analysis, or feasibility within hospitality, real estate, consulting, or banking. Direct hotel feasibility/development experience is highly desirable but not essential.Advanced Excel and financial modelling expertise; experience with valuation and underwriting methods. Strong commercial acumen and the ability to interpret P&L statements, cash flow forecasts, and key performance metrics.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate complex analysis into clear, data-driven recommendations.Knowledge of European real estate or hospitality markets is preferred; a strong willingness and ability to learn sector-specific dynamics is expected.Ability to assess long-term opportunities, risks, and their alignment with Staycity's growth strategy.What you can do for us...Market Research & Benchmarking: Conduct in-depth market research to support feasibility analysis. Data Management: Maintain comprehensive databases of market intelligence, benchmarking data, and financial models.Feasibility Studies: Prepare clear, persuasive feasibility presentations and recommendations for senior leadership and external stakeholders.Performance Monitoring: Track and analyse the operational performance of existing assets versus underwriting assumptions, providing recommendations for optimisation.Due Diligence: Support lease negotiations with financial assessments, stress-testing scenarios, and other commercial due diligence. Site Visits: Conduct visits to assess project viability, location, and performance against competitor hotels.Reporting: Provide updates on pipeline opportunities, market performance, and investment metrics to the development team and senior management.Collaboration: Work with development, finance, operations, and revenue management teams to ensure alignment of assumptions and projections.If you thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment where ambiguity is met with enthusiasm and determination, and if you lead with kindness, clarity, and curiosity, we'd love to hear from you.Start your Staycity Group journey - apply now!

Job SummaryOur successful and long-standing investment team, based in Blackrock, Co. Dublin, is seeking to recruit an Assistant Equity Portfolio Manager with a focus on North American equities. This role is suited to candidates who have gained foundational experience within the investment industry, ideally with exposure to equity markets. We are looking for someone who is passionate about investments, demonstrates strong analytical skills, and is eager to build on their existing expertise as part of a collaborative and high-performing team.Your RoleThe main responsibilities of the successful candidate will include but will not be limited to:Security research analysisPortfolio analysis including performance and risk analysisClose collaboration with colleagues in the Zurich Life investment teamCollaboration with other local functions and with the global investment colleaguesYour Skills And ExperienceTechnical CompetenciesAn interest in equity markets and ESG related mattersGood judgement and decision-making skillsNumerate, analytical, and methodicalWillingness to engage with challenging external environmentsGood Academic backgroundNon-Technical CompetenciesPerformance and outcomes focusedGood interpersonal skillsWillingness and ability to work within a teamOpen and flexible approachWillingness to obtain the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designationAdditional InformationPrimary work location is Blackrock. Position is Dublin-based.If you value an exciting and varied working environment and meet the above requirements, then our recruiter is looking forward to receiving your application by clicking on the button “Apply online”.This role may be available on a full-time and part-time basis. Please discuss with us the flexibility you may require.Who we areZurich is one of Ireland's leading insurance companies providing a wide range of general insurance and life insurance products and services. The company employs over 1,000 people across its locations in Dublin and Wexford.Zurich is a strong brand – with our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, helping our customers in 210 countries and territories to understand and protect themselves from risk. In order to deliver our services, we offer our employees flexible working models and interesting opportunities for further training & development.As a Zurich employee you benefit from a multitude of advantages as well as a strong culture, characterized by acceptance, diversity and team spirit. At Zurich, we foster a culture of diversity and inclusion. Our purpose and values are designed to protect, inspire confidence and help our employees reach their full potential. We value and defend what is right and promote opportunities for equity among our professionals, regardless of gender, disability, LGBTQ +, race, ethnicity, generations, belief, etc. Join Zurich and be part of this culture. Together we are committed to delivering on our purpose - Let’s Create a Brighter Future Together!

This role offers the opportunity to join a high-performing investment team. In this role, you will be responsible for the origination and execution of real estate credit transactions. As a manager, you will also play a key role in mentoring analysts and associates.Responsibilities:Business development and relationship building.Detailed credit analysis to support new investment recommendations.Proactive credit management of existing investments.Managing transaction execution, including due diligence, negotiation, structuring, and presenting to the Executive Team and Investment Committee.Managing and developing junior members of the Credit Team within a high-performing culture.Key Requirements:A minimum of 5 years’ experience in investments, corporate finance or real estate.A strong academic background and a professional qualification (CFA, ACA or ACCA) is highly, desirable.A team player with a proactive mindset, geared toward learning and collaboration.

We are partnering with a leading financial services firm to recruit an experienced, client-centric Financial Advisor. This is a pivotal role within an established team, requiring expert knowledge of investment products, pension planning, and protection solutions. The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering high-level wealth management, providing strategic advice, and fostering long-term client relationships.The ideal candidate is a proactive professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment and balances a target-driven mindset with a commitment to the highest standards of compliance and "best advice" principles.SkillsQFA qualifiedMinimum of 5+ years in financial advisory or wealth management.Deep knowledge of investment products, pension planning (Personal, Executive, and Group), and protection products.A strong understanding of current regulatory requirements and AML procedures.Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to simplify complex financial concepts for clients.A self-starter who is highly organised, analytical, and capable of working calmly under pressure to meet revenue targets.ResponsibilitiesBuild and maintain long-term, trusted partnerships through regular communication, portfolio reviews, and performance updates.Grow the life, pension, and investment portfolio by managing the existing client base and proactively identifying new business opportunities.Conduct in-depth financial assessments to provide professional recommendations tailored to client goals, tax strategies, and estate planning.Oversee the entire business lifecycle, from onboarding and pipeline management to processing applications and renewals.Deliver presentations to group pension scheme members and manage corporate renewals.Ensure all files meet current regulatory and AML standards while staying updated on market trends and economic shifts.

Our client, a leading global private markets investment firm, is seeking a Senior Associate to join its Dublin based portfolio analytics team.This role is central to maintaining the integrity of private debt data and insights with a focus on investment monitoring, portfolio valuation, and team leadership.The successful candidate will oversee a team of analysts, manage end-to-end data workflows, and collaborate across functions to ensure accurate, timely, and accurate information across investment systems and reporting processes.Essential Job Functions:Lead and mentor a team of analysts, overseeing task allocation, performance, and skills development while driving continuous improvement.Monitor private debt and real estate investments, tracking key metrics and engaging with investment teams on emerging risks.Support portfolio valuation cycles, including data sourcing, validation, material preparation, timeline management, and audit coordination.Serve as a primary contact for valuation agents and auditors, ensuring clear communication and accurate data delivery.Identify and resolve data issues, improve data quality, and support scalable, automated workflows with internal stakeholders.Maintain accurate, auditable documentation of core processes and ensure alignment with internal control standards.Produce team KPIs, dashboards, and operational reports while managing inboxes and delivering timely stakeholder communication.Education and/or Work Experience RequirementsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.At least 5 years’ experience in alternative investments or capital markets, ideally with recent exposure to private debt, liquid credit, or leveraged finance.Proven experience leading or mentoring analysts or small teams.Strong understanding of financial statements and credit metrics.Advanced Excel skills, including financial modelling, data validation, and automation; familiarity with SQL or Power BI is a plus.Excellent attention to detail, organisation, and problem-solving skills.Clear, confident communicator with strong cross-functional collaboration abilities.Able to manage multiple priorities and deliver high-quality work in a fast-paced environment.

Kroll Portfolio Valuation practice specializes in assisting clients with the valuation of alternative investments, specifically securities and positions for which there are no "active market" quotations such as illiquid securities for hedge funds, private equity funds, business development corporations and fund of funds. Furthermore, the candidate will gain experience in valuations for financial reporting, tax and management planning purposes. Analysts work on a variety of assignments, including business enterprise valuations, purchase price allocations, intellectual property valuations, stock option valuations, and dispute consulting. The opportunity is ideal for professionals who are interested in learning global best practices, tools and techniques by working on valuation engagements for global clients.Navigating ResponsibilitiesBuilding long-term client relationships through exceptional client service including a deep understanding of the client and their needs, exceptional responsiveness, and the delivery of the highest quality service and work productDeveloping deep technical strength in the valuation of alternative assets, serving as a firm resource for that expertise and sharing that knowledge through training and mentoringManaging client engagements from day-to-day interaction with the client through to staffing and managing the resources and work plan through to timely completionIndividuals will be assigned a wide variety of projects and given as much responsibility as their experience and capabilities permitProject management including client interviewing, engagement economics, team management, report writing, research and tracking market and industry informationModel building and reviewing - DCF models, comparable company models, stock option models, financial instrument, and loan valuationsWriting industry reports on emerging sectors and coverage reports on valuation of global Unicorns in the emerging sectorsProgramming skills, like VBA and Python would be considered a plus.The IdealCurrent Degree Pursuit: Bachelor or Master’s degree in finance, Accounting, Financial Engineering or Economics. Holding an MBA will be valuable.Task Prioritization: Prioritize tasks in a collaborative team environment. Analytical Thinker: Detail-oriented thinker with quick evaluation skills.Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills that help represent diverse communitiesLanguage Skills: Fluency in EnglishAbout KrollJoin the global leader in risk and financial advisory solutions—Kroll. With a nearly century-long legacy, we blend trusted expertise with cutting-edge technology to navigate and redefine industry complexities. As a part of One Team, One Kroll, you'll contribute to a collaborative and empowering environment, propelling your career to new heights. Ready to build, protect, restore and maximize our clients’ value? Your journey begins with Kroll.Kroll is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit.In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.

job_title: DP of Investment Management - 12 month FTC (Part-Time)
job_description: Our client, a leading investment management firm based in Dublin, is seeking an experienced Investment Oversight Officer for a 12-month fixed-term contract. This part-time role (21 hours per week) offers an excellent opportunity to contribute to the development and maintenance of a robust investment oversight framework. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, protecting investor interests, and providing strategic leadership in investment oversight activities. This role requires office-based work in Dublin.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain comprehensive investment oversight policies, procedures, and frameworks in compliance with UCITS Directive, AIFMD, and Central Bank of Ireland requirements.Act as PCF30 (CIO) and PCF39D (Designated Person for Investment Management)Provide senior-level oversight of delegated investment managers, ensuring adherence to policies, risk parameters, and regulatory obligations.Lead quarterly and ad-hoc due diligence reviews of investment managers, assessing their resources, performance, and capabilities.Monitor and evaluate investment performance, risk metrics, portfolio positioning, and adherence to mandates across all funds.Prepare and present detailed investment oversight reports to the Board, Management Committee, and regulatory authorities as needed.RequirementsProven experience in investment management, fund oversight, or related asset management functions, with prior experience in a PCF role or similar controlled functions in Ireland or the EU.Strong understanding of Irish and EU regulatory frameworks, including UCITS Directive, AIFMD, and Central Bank of Ireland requirements.Demonstrated expertise in investment strategies, portfolio construction, risk management, and performance measurement.Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex investment data and market information.Strong project management capabilities and exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

We have an excellent opportunity for a Senior Investment Analyst to join the High Yield Fixed Income team at Mediolanum International Funds.Reporting to the Head of High Yield, as a Senior Investment Analyst, you will be required to conduct high yield credit research with low supervision across a range of industries, following a detailed process the outcome of the research will be reviewed with the head of high yield.The successful candidate will be motivated by the challenge of investing to outperform the market and will enjoy being part of a successful and growing team. This is an exceptional opportunity to join an organisation that truly values collaboration and encourages active input from all team members.Principal Duties of the position, including but not limited to:Preparation of new credit research where opportunities have been identified in the high yield market.Continuous monitoring of positions held in the portfolio, reviewing whether credit views have changed and discussing those changes with the head of high yield.Assisting with the enhancement of understanding high yield across the fixed income and wider Mediolanum team.Production of one new piece of credit research every week, to be reviewed by head of high yield.Daily updates to the high yield team of events affecting positions held in the portfolio.Assisting with the mentoring and development of junior members within the team.Skills and Competencies:Strong analytical and communication skills.Team player with the ability to collaborate with all members of the investment team and organisation.Growth mindset with a desire to learn and develop.Strong curiosity with a willingness to ask questions.Qualifications and Experience:A University Degree in a relative subject such as finance or mathematics.A minimum of 5 years’ experience within Investment, specifically with strong knowledge of the high yield market.Proven experience and skill in analysing financial statements.Be able to provide detailed analysis under time pressure.Ability to debate robustly credit opportunities with members of the Investment team.

OverviewAre you interested in working for an outstanding global investment firm and looking to take the next step in your career in Finance? Want to become an expert in and build a career advising clients on financial markets and investments? Want to focus on forging strong client relationships and providing exceptional client service?Fisher Investments Luxembourg – Dublin Branch is a European subsidiary of Fisher Investments, a privately-held investment management firm that provides professional discretionary portfolio management services for high net worth private clients and some of the world's preeminent institutions. Our organisation has grown significantly over the past decade and we are looking for motivated candidates with finance backgrounds to join our team as Investment Counsellors to help us better the financial industry in Belgium as we continue our expansion in Europe.The Opportunity:The Investment Counsellor (IC) role is focused on managing relationships with high-net-worth clients in Belgium from our office in Dublin. Your ability to understand our clients' needs and educate them on the reasoning behind portfolio changes will be crucial to your success in this role. You will report to your Team Manager who will aid in your professional development.The Day-To-Day: Build long standing relationships with our clients, ensuring they always receive exceptional service Manage a book of high-net-worth relationships with approximately €100-150 million in assets Be the conduit between our clients, our Investment Policy Committee, our research and trading departments, and several service teams Proactively update clients on portfolio changes, financial markets, our current market strategy and investment philosophy Gain advanced finance and capital markets education through our training program Your Qualifications: 2+ years exposure to private clients within the banking /wealth management industry A sound knowledge of financial concepts, markets, current events and the market Native/Fluent French and English skills, Flemish & Dutch is also highly beneficial Connect with and educate a variety of audiences Maintain a positive personality and empathise with clients in good times and bad MiFID certification, training or the equivalent CFA or similar education is beneficial Your Benefits: The global Fisher organisation distinguishes itself by putting clients first, providing unmatched service, and taking a personalised approach to investing. You can feel confident knowing that Fisher Investments and Fisher Investments Luxembourg align with our clients’ priorities by using a simple and transparent fee structure and recognised European custodians.It’s the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and to help our employees meet their long-term goals, we offer an array of benefits, including: 100% paid premiums for our top-tier supplemental healthcare and dental plans for employees and their qualified dependents 28 days annual leave, with the ability to purchase up to 3 additional days per year, plus up to 11 paid holidays Enhanced maternity pay package with 26 weeks’ top up to full base pay for eligible employees $10,000* fertility, hormonal health and family-forming benefit A retirement pension plan, featuring a 9% company pension contribution of your base pay and an additional company match of up to 5% of base pay Monthly gym subsidy of up to €50 per month Employee Assistance Program and other emotional wellbeing services A collaborative working environment that practices ongoing training, educational support and employee appreciation events This is an in-office role. Based on your role, tenure, and performance eligibility you may have the opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home program. This program is subject to change. Employees residing outside of the US will be eligible for the $10,000 equivalent in their local currency.FISHER INVESTMENTS LUXEMBOURG IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

About WalkersFinancial institutions, capital markets participants, investment fund managers, global corporations and family offices all rely on us for the legal, corporate, compliance, formation and fiduciary services they need to succeed in today’s markets. Sixty years of looking at the world through the same commercial lens as our clients means we deliver focused, clear, precise advice to get the deal done. Clients trust us to help them make good business decisions, create commercially sound products and strategies, resolve disputes and cement deals that are profitable.From offices across geographies, we deliver business critical advice and services in the same time zones as our clients. Frequently acknowledged as the go-to firm for offshore legal advice, in a changing world we are a safe pair of hands in six globally important financial jurisdictions. Consistently ranked in the top-tier of the leading legal directories, our people and our approach to solving our clients' challenges and ambitions are tried and tested, but that doesn’t mean we ever stand still. Markets change, regulations evolve, businesses adapt, and we keep on reinventing our services for the times we find ourselves in.About The OpportunityWe are currently seeking a Legal Analyst to join Walkers in Summer 2026. This opportunity is geared towards graduates and post-graduates who are completing their FE-1s and who are interested in taking on a contract as a legal analyst for 6-12 months.This role will provide those who have an interest in financial services and in the law, an opportunity to immerse themselves in these areas and to work with Walkers for an extended period. The programme has been designed to support you in your journey to becoming a future trainee, associate and partner.We know that financial services can be an alien concept to some and for the most part it isn’t something that is covered by a University degree. But it is an extremely interesting and fast-paced area of law and we are offering people an opportunity to learn more about it. During the programme, you will work with lawyers who are experts in their field. You will be part of the team and will work alongside the partners in delivering first class legal advice to clients. Whether you are representing a client in buying or leasing an aircraft, advising a bank (we act for 85 of the top 100 banks in the world), or attending a board meeting for an investment fund, you will be involved at every stage of the process. In the world of finance, transactions move at speed and we deal with different time zones and other lawyers and clients across the globe. It isn’t for everyone, but if it is for you, you won’t learn your craft better anywhere else.The role of legal analyst provides an excellent opportunity to work closely with our lawyers on a wide range of matters and clients. Once you take your seat, your role will involve a range of responsibilities. You will also be involved in assisting the lawyers in your group with drafting and review of legal and security documents, agreements, corporate authorisations, and various other transaction documents. Duties may include arranging for documents to be notarised and apostilled. Through your role, you will also be involved in assisting the lawyers in advising their clients and in liaising with directors as well as other service providers. Essentially the programme will see you develop your knowledge and skills (e.g. communication, project management, practice management, advanced writing and drafting, legal research and business development), enabling you to continue your career path and, possibly, take up a training contract at WalkersThe PersonWe are seeking candidates who have an interest in learning more about financial services and ultimately pursuing a career as a solicitor. Candidates applying should consider their suitability for the role and whether they hold a number of the following minimum requirement competencies:A strong academic record;Commercial awareness;Flexibility and a willingness to learn;Ability to multi-task and work within strict deadlines;Excellent attention to detail;Excellent organisational, administrative prioritisation skills;A proactive and can-do approach; andAbility to work effectively under pressure.BenefitsCore benefits 20 days annual leave Private healthcare Life cover and income protection Employee assistance programme Training and development Structured learning and mentoringOpportunities for client secondmentsExposure to international clients Health and wellbeing Wellness programme with annual health screening Free flu vaccination VDU eye testing support Travel and financial wellbeing Tax saver travel schemes Bike to work scheme Bank at Work scheme Culture and community Social events including trainee specific events CSR opportunities Active DEI Committee Work environment and facilities Dress for your day Agile working options Central IFSC location Showers and secure bike storage Onsite dry

Elgin Values Core Behavioural Responsibilities For All EmployeesAgility We Lead with AgilityIntegrity We Act with IntegrityExcellence We Empower ExcellenceCare We Value CareIntegration of our four core values into our employment processes and frameworks allows Elgin to recognise and respect individual employees for their personal contributions to their roles, their colleagues, stakeholders, and ultimately to the renewable energy sector. We see sustainability as every employee’s responsibility and weaving sustainable practices into our values is paramount to the culture we seek to create.Job DescriptionReporting to the Financial Modelling Associate, the ideal candidate should have extensive experience in financial analysis and modelling. The role will include:Assisting with group’s modelling activities with full oversight across a variety of jurisdictions and markets;Discounted cashflow modelling for asset valuation and investment appraisal.Developing relationships with stakeholders, working alongside industry peers to glean data inputs and stay abreast of all technical modelling matters;Probing into potential financing arrangement scenarios and their implications on the existing group; Supporting the group’s go-to-market activities, understanding the sales process and due diligence requirements and providing insight throughout the process; Drive business development, researching market variables across a variety of jurisdictions, assessing viability and opportunities in any new markets identified; andHelp build technical knowledge across the wider internal team.Your profileStrong consulting background or experience gained in a relevant industry role;The successful candidate should have an excellent knowledge of Excel and it’s uses in financial modelling and management;Proven ability to build, interrogate and renew financial models; Possess strong financial acumen, including an awareness for funding/ financing arrangements and the impact on group modelling;Excellent communication skills including report drafting, delivering presentations and an ability to influence all levels of the business;A professionally recognised finance (e.g. CFA) or accounting qualification (e.g. ACA, ACCA) would be an advantage;Knowledge of the renewable energy sector a distinct advantage but not a prerequisite; andThe successful candidate should have at least 3-5 years experience.About UsElgin is a fully integrated, utility-scale solar and storage Independent Power Producer, developing, building, owning and operating renewable energy assets across the UK, Ireland, Germany and Italy. With a 10GW+ pipeline spanning solar, co-located and standalone storage projects, Elgin brings projects from origination through development to energisation and long-term operation.The company has delivered over 1GW of ready-to-build projects, with more than 200MW currently under construction across the UK and Ireland. Elgin is backed by Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP), which acquired a majority stake in 2024, supporting the company’s long-term growth and ambition to scale.Founded in 2009, Elgin operates from offices in Dublin, London, Ulm and Rome, with a team of over 150 professionals driving the delivery of large-scale renewable energy projects. For more information, visit www.elgin.com .

job_description: About UsAt Munich Re Specialty – Global Markets (MRS-GM), it is our ambition to become the leading Primary Specialty Insurance provider, underpinned by an effective and adaptable strategy, superior products and industry leaders working in a supportive environment to achieve this.At the heart of our success is a strong culture where people are encouraged to be present, bold and curious, allowing them to achieve their individual goals.Please see our website for more information.Country Claims Manager, IrelandWe are currently looking for a Claims Manager to work with us on a full-time basis in Dublin, reporting into the Group Claims Director.The Country Claims Manager, Ireland is responsible for the end-to-end management, oversight, and compliant handling of insurance claims across Cargo (Marine), Property, Construction / Engineering and Professional Indemnity lines, and any other lines of business as the portfolio grows in Ireland. The role will help design and build the process, systems and tools to build the Claims capabilities required to support the portfolio. The Country Claim Manager, Ireland will also ensure that all claims are managed in full compliance with all regulations applying to Ireland, to meet CBI conduct expectations and applicable EU requirements and build the team as the business grows. This role will drive a proactive, strategic approach to claims, in an energetic and collaborative work environment, to deliver a best-in-class claims service to our clients and partners. This position is a key control function within the Irish claims framework and plays a critical role in ensuring regulatory compliance, technical excellence, and operational resilience.Responsibilities: Claims Handling, Technical Oversight and DeliveryManage a portfolio of complex and high-value claims across the Cargo / Marine, Property, Professional Indemnity and Construction & Engineering portfolio, and other line of business as it grows and changes.Provide technical oversight of coverage, liability, quantum, policy interpretation, and recovery opportunities.Instruct and manage external experts (loss adjusters, surveyors, engineers, forensic accountants, and legal counsel).Ensure claims handling is prompt, proactive, reasonable and fair using evidence-based decision-making.Enable, support and implement delivery of end-to-end claims services amid a growing portfolio, including delegated claims oversight. Claims Capabilities and Regulatory ComplianceWork with operational delivery teams to build end-to-end claims capabilities for all lines of business.Support process, system and tool design and implementations for delivery of claim handling in Ireland.Ensure all claims handling complies with Irish and EU regulatory requirements, including but not limited to Central Bank of Ireland (CBI); Consumer Protection Code (CPC); Consumer Insurance Contracts Act 2019 (CICA); IDD; Solvency II; and EIOPAEmbed fair, accurate, transparent, timely, and customer-focused claims handling in line with regulations.Support internal and external audits, regulatory reviews, and inspections.Oversee and resolve claims-related complaints, ensuring root-cause analysis, compliance with regulatory timeframes, and clear audit trails and defensible outcomes.Act as an escalation point for complex or sensitive claims issues.Governance, Controls & ReportingMaintain strong claims governance, including file quality standards, peer review and quality assurance, and delegated authority controls.Produce and contribute to management information (MI) covering:Identify conduct, operational, or systemic risks and support remediation initiatives.Stakeholder ManagementProvide input into Ireland Underwriting strategy from a claims perspective.Work closely with Underwriting, Distribution, and Finance to align Claims with business goals.Support Underwriting feedback loops to improve wordings, risk selection, and pricing.People & CapabilityProvide technical guidance and mentoring to claims staff.Contribute to training initiatives on regulatory compliance and technical best practice.Support staffing capability build-out in Ireland as required for the portfolio.Knowledge And SkillsProven claims and/or relevant legal experience in company market claims.Proven management experience and/or leadership roles.Experience handling cargo/marine, property, PI and/or construction engineering claims. Additional lines experience a plus.Superior critical thinking skills, detail-oriented and curious problem-solver.Fair, adaptable, and approachable.Customer-service focus and relationship-oriented.Diversity, Equity & Inclusion At Munich Re, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion foster innovation and resilience and enable us to act braver and better. job_description: Deloitte is the biggest professional services Firm in the world and making an impact is more than just what we do: it’s why we’re here. Joining us means becoming part of a Consulting team that’s at the top of its game and growing. Working with the best people and technology in the market, you’ll tackle meaningful projects that transform the future for high-profile local and international clients. And you’ll do it as part of a people-first culture that’s supportive, collaborative and, above all, welcoming.Why you'll enjoy this new opportunityAt Deloitte, we are at the forefront of driving digital transformation within pharmaceutical manufacturing. As the Digital Manufacturing Business Operations Lead, you will have a strategic role in shaping and evolving the digital manufacturing strategy, processes, and operating model across all digital and manufacturing system capabilities. Establish and sustain the digital lifecycle management process to drive the delivery of the digital roadmap and accelerate value realisation. Design and implement a digital value model to enable effective investment prioritisation and portfolio management. Who is the Hiring Manager? The hiring manager is an experienced leader in digital manufacturing solutions with a strong background in Digital solution implementations within the pharmaceutical industry to include Manufacturing execution systems, supply chain planning and execution systems among others. measurable business outcomes.Operating at the centre of a complex transformation agenda, you will work closely with Executive sponsors and senior leadership to bring structure, transparency and pace to delivery.The RoleYou will act as the portfolio integrator across multiple workstreams, ensuring that strategic initiatives operate as one coherent change agenda rather than disconnected programmes.This role requires strong judgement, commercial awareness and the confidence to operate at Executive level, providing a trusted and objective perspective on progress, risk and value delivery.Key ResponsibilitiesProvide enterprise-level oversight of a portfolio of strategic initiativesEnsure initiatives are aligned to strategic priorities and defined outcomesMaintain visibility of interdependencies, sequencing, risks and resource constraintsIdentify emerging delivery risks early and drive appropriate escalationTrack benefits realisation and overall value delivery across the portfolioProvide clear, forward-looking reporting to Executive leadershipPresent structured options and recommendations where trade-offs are requiredStrengthen governance discipline and ensure decision forums are outcome-focusedAct as a neutral integrator across functions, balancing competing prioritiesCandidate ProfileProven experience overseeing complex, multi-stream enterprise transformationComfortable operating across programmes without direct line authorityCredible and confident engaging at Executive levelStrong systems thinker with the ability to anticipate cross-functional impactsSkilled at influencing senior stakeholders and constructively challenging where neededCommercially minded, outcome-focused and pragmaticStructured and composed in high-visibility, fast-paced environmentsHow to ApplyIf you are interested in this opportunity, please apply by submitting your updated CV for consideration.

In Ireland, Neoen owns a portfolio of eight wind farms totalling 53 MW and 3 solar farms totalling 58 MWp. We are currently constructing another 100 MWp of solar and have a pipeline of 1.7 GW in development across wind, solar and BESS.Our Development Team is looking for a Business Development Manager. Reporting to the Head of Business Development, you will be responsible for the development of a portfolio of wind, solar, and battery storage projects, from identifying the site to securing the land and the permits until handover to the Construction team.The Main Tasks IncludeProspection of new sites for the development of projects;Analysis of the electrical network infrastructures to facilitate the interconnection of the projects;Development of plans to lead or assist with landowner negotiations (on site, road access, cable, and overhead line wayleaves, etc.);External stakeholder management including landowners, local communities, local authorities, and elected representatives;Oversight of third-party partners and providers of technical services;Management of the planning process and grid connection process;Management of financial models supporting the business case of projects;Assist with the identification of routes to market for the various technologies.Support the Construction and Asset management teams; Adherence to Health & Safety procedures;Regular management reporting.Degree in engineering, planning or business administration, with specialisation in renewable energy, environment or project management;3 to 5 years of relevant work experience is required. Proficiency in the use of GIS/AutoCad software is considered an advantage;Strong motivation to work in a complex environment : you are organised, open-minded and able to work independently; you are capable of working on several projects in parallel;Team player with the ability to foster and maintain good working relationships both internally and with external stakeholdersExcellent oral and written skills;Full clean driving license (frequent travelling will be required for field work within Ireland and occasional travel for meetings at the Headquarters in Paris, France).

job_description: What We Do…Findlater & Co, as part of the Valeo Foods Ireland portfolio, is the leading importer and distributor to restaurant and retail customers established in Dublin in 1823, now based in Broomhill, Tallaght. We offer a unique and exclusive portfolio of wine, coffee, spirits, and ingredients.What We are Looking For….We are looking for an enthusiastic Customer Service /Telesales Executive to join our busy customer service team on a permanent full-time basis. This role will report into the Customer Service Manager and is based in Broomhill Road Tallaght. The successful candidate will work closely with the field sales team and other departments within the business helping to maintain good customer relationships and contribute to generating sales.What You will Do…Delivery of a professional, efficient, and timely standard of customer service.Contact existing customers via outbound calls to generate sales, upselling and informingcustomers of current promotional offers.Ensure inbound calls are answered in a timely and professional manner.Processing orders from sales teams and customers via phone, email, and online portals .Supporting the sales teams and other departments on all day-to-day admin.Issuing daily & weekly reports to detect potential issues and maximize order fulfilment.Effectively resolve customer service challenges and find solutions which exceedcustomer expectations.Contribute to the overall success of the sales teams.Any other ad hoc duties as assigned by the customer service manager.What You will Have…Previous experience working in a similar role.Strong I.T. capability and excellent data analysis skillsExcellent communication and organisational skillsGood customer care attitude and ability to work on own initiative.Ability to multi-task, set priorities and manage time effectively.Experience within the FMCG industry.Who You are…A team player with a flexible and adaptable approach in a busy environment.Results Driven with a collaborative style and positive attitude.Treats colleagues and customer with respect and is always honest in all interactions.Demonstrate agility by being flexible and open to change.Contribute to overall team performance, including support and assistance to other team members.Focused individual with ability to drive personal, team and business growth and maximise opportunities with customers.

job_title: Audit Manager - Financial Services (FS) Wealth and Asset Management Dublin/Cork
job_description: At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.Join EY and help to build a better working world.Audit Manager – Financial Services (FS) Wealth and Asset Management Dublin/CorkGeneral InformationLocation: Dublin / CorkAvailable for Work Visa Sponsorship: YesBusiness Area: FSO AssuranceContract Type: Full-Time – PermanentAssurance is our largest service line, where you will work with the highest performing teams serving industry leading asset management clients, both locally and globally.Financial Services Assurance has grown significantly over the last 3 years due to the continued success story of the financial services industry in Ireland together with a number of significant global audit wins across our Wealth and Asset Management practice. As a result, we are looking to grow and develop our team to build upon this success.The opportunity to join a growing Wealth and Asset Management audit team that have developed and capitalised on growth opportunities offers significant options for career progression. Understand our service lines and actively assess ways to apply knowledge and services and grow our business.
